sp.p: You are going to refuse ! YAOUMAwith a radiant smileYou would love me no longer , if I refused .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: But know you not , it is death ? YAOUMAin ecstasyYes , Satni , it is death !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You are mine — You are plighted to me — Come — Come !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Satni — Satni — you would not have me refuse ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I would . I love you .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Refuse to answer the call of the Gods .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: The call of the Gods is death .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: The God has chosen me , before all he has preferred me . He has preferred me to those who are fairer , to those who are richer . And I should hide myself !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: It is out of pride then that you would die ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I die to bring the flooding of the Nile — to make fertile all the Egyptian fields . If I answer not to the voices that call me , my name will be a byword wherever the rays of the sun-God fall . Another than I will go clothed in the dazzling robe . Another will hear the shouting of the multitude . Another will be given to the Nile .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Another will die , and you , you will live , for your own joy and for mine .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: For my own shame and for yours .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Light the world with your beauty . Live , Yaouma , live with me ! Bright shall your breast be with the flower of the persea , and your tresses anointed heavy with sweet odor .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: The waves of the Nile will be my head-dress . Oh ! fair green robe , with flowers yet more fair .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yaouma , you loved me —She bends her headRemember , remember my going away , but two years since , how you did weep when I embarked . You ran by the bank , you followed the boat that bore me . I see you still , the slim form , the swift lank limbs ; I can hear still the sound of your little naked feet upon the sand . And when the boat grounded — do you remember ? For hours the oarsmen pushed with long poles , singing the while , and you clapping your hands and crying out my name . And when at length we floated , there was laughter and cries of joy — but you , you did stand all on a sudden still , and I knew then that you wept . You climbed to a hillock , and you waved your arms , you grew smaller , smaller , smaller , till we turned by a cluster of palms . Oh , how you promised to wait for me !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Have I not waited ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: We had chosen the place to build our home . Do you remember ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: And dreamed of nights when you should sleep with your head upon my breast —Yaouma bends her headAnd now you seek a grave in the slime of the river . YAOUMAwith fervorThe slime of the river is holy , the river is holy . The Nile is nine times holy . It makes grow the pasture that feeds our flocks . It drinks the tears of all our eyes .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Listen , Yaouma , I will reveal the truth to you . The Gods who claim your sacrifice — the Gods are false .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: The Gods are true —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: They are powerless .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: It is their power that subdues me — it is stronger than love . Until to-day I loved you more than all the living things upon the earth — the breath of your mouth alone gave life to my heart . Even this very day , I dreaded being chosen of the Gods . But now , who has so utterly transformed me if it be not the Gods ? You are to me as nothing , now . And I who trembled at a scorpion , who wept at the pricking of a thorn , I am all joy at the thought of dying soon . How could this be if the Gods had not willed it ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Hear me a little — and I can prove to you —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: No words can take away the glory of being chosen by the Gods .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: By the priests .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: ‘ Tis the same , the priests are the voice of the Gods .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: ‘ Tis they who say so . The Gods of Egypt exist only because men have invented them .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: The peoples from whose lands you come have made you lose your reason .With a smile of pitySay that our Gods exist not ! Think , Satni !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Neither the Gods , nor the happy fields , nor the world to come , nor hell .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Ah ! Ah ! I will prove you mad — you say there is no hell — But we know , we know that it exists , look there !Pointing to the sunsetWhen the sun grows red at evening , is it not because the glow of hell is thrown upon it from below ? You have but to open your eyes .LaughingThe Gods not exist !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: They do not . In the sanctuaries of our temples is nothing save beasts , unclean , absurd , and lifeless images ; believe me , Yaouma — I love you — I will not see you die . Your sacrifice is useless . Not because you are offered up will the waters of the Nile rise ! Refuse , hide yourself , the waters will still rise . Ah , to lose you for a lie ! To lose you — you ! How can I convince you ?— I know ! Yaouma , you saw me cross the dead scarabs on my path . And yet I live ! Oh ! it angers me to see my words move you not . Your reason , your reason ! Awaken your reason —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I am listening to my heart .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I will save you in spite of you — I will keep you by force —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: If you do , I shall hate you —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: What matter I shall have saved you .

lg.l: Will you not understand ! The God-bull , the
God-hippopotamus , the God-jackal — they are naught but idols !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: My father worshipped them . Every one comes back . Rheou , who during all the preceding scene was hidden behind a pillar , goes to meet them .

sp.speaker: SOME MEN
sp.p: Yaouma ! Yaouma !

sp.speaker: ANOTHER
sp.p: Up to the terrace !

sp.speaker: OTHERS
sp.p: Up to the terrace ! Let her go up to the terrace !

sp.speaker: ANOTHER
sp.p: And let her lift her arms to heaven !

lg.l: Let her show that she will give herself to the Nile .
Stay ! Stay with me ! Then together —
He has chosen me from among all others !

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: Yaouma !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: She has refused ! She has refused ! And I will take her away .

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: No ! No ! To the terrace ! The prayer ! The prayer !

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Yaouma , go and pray .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: She has refused !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Choose , Yaouma , between our Gods and a man .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Between the glory of sacrifice —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Between falsehood and me , Yaouma —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: The God has called me to save my brothers !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You are going to death !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: To life — the real life — the life with the Gods .Going to the terrace

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: They lie !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Peace !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: In spite of you , I will save you .Yaouma goes up the stairway leading to the terrace . Satni stands on a bench and shouts to the crowdHear me , my brothers , I know of better Gods , of Gods who ask for no victims —

sp.speaker: THE PEOPLE
sp.p: They are false Gods !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: They are better Gods —

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Rheou ! Rheou ! bid him cease !

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: No — let him speak .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I come to save you from error , to overthrow the idols , to teach you eternal truths — An immense shout of acclamation drowns the rest of Satni 's words , as Yaouma , who has appeared on the terrace above , stands with her arms raised to the setting sun . Mieris kneels and crosses her hands in prayer .

div.stage: CURTAIN

div.head: ACT II

stage.stage: SCENE : Same as Act I .
Rheou discovered alone . After a few moments the Steward enters through the gates .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: What have you seen ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: The preparations for the festival continue .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: At the Temple ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: At the Temple .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: For the Feast of Prodigies ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: For the Feast of Prodigies .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: And the priests believe they can celebrate it to-morrow ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: I have seen no reason to doubt of it .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Without Yaouma ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: I do not know .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: You are mistaken perhaps . Did you go down as far as the Nile ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes , master .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Well ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: They have finished the decoration of the sacred barge .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: I do not understand it .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Nor I , for I know that a certain number of the soldiers have refused to renew the attempt of yesterday —

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: They have refused ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: What did they say ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: That they were afraid .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Of what — of whom ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Of Satni .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Of Satni ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes . They say it was he who caused the miracle of yesterday .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: What — what do they say ? Their words — tell me ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: That it was he —

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: He , Satni ?—

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Who caused the miracle of yesterday ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: The miracle that prevented them from carrying out the order of the High Priest ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: The order to come here and seize Yaouma ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: So that is what they say ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Every one says it . RHEOUafter some reflectionCome , it is time you learned the truth , that you may repeat it all . In the countries whither he went Satni learned many things — great things . Come hither , lend your ear . He declares there be other gods than the gods of Egypt — and more powerful . If you remember , my father and the Pharaoh Amenotep likewise declared this , and would have made these gods known to us . How they were frustrated you know . It seems — for my own part I know not , ‘ tis Satni says so , ceaselessly , these two months since his return — it seems then , the time is come when these Gods would make them known to us . They have endowed Satni with superhuman power . That I know , and none may doubt it now . Satni is resolved to keep his betrothed , and the Lybian Guards were not deceived , it was he who yesterday called down the thunder and the floods from Heaven upon the soldiers sent here to seize Yaouma .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: The oldest remember but one such prodigy .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: What I have told you , tell to all ; and this , besides , say to them : each time that any would cross the will of Satni — they who dare the attempt will be scattered , even as the guards were scattered yesterday . Add this , that Satni is guided by the spirit of the dead Pharaoh , that I last night beheld my father 's spirit , and that great events will come to pass in Egypt .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: I shall tell them .

lg.l: Behold , the envoy of the new gods ! Leave me to speak with him .
Satni enters from the back . Rheou prostrates himself before
Before which God do you still bow down ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Before you . If you be not a God , you are the spirit of a God .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I do not understand your words .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Who can call down thunderbolts from heaven , unless he be an envoy of the Gods ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I am no —

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: ‘ Tis well , ‘ tis well . You would have us blind to your power of working miracles . After yesterday you can hide it no more . Henceforth , Satni , you must no longer confine your teaching to Mieris , to me , to your parents , Yaouma , to a few — henceforth you may speak to all , all ears are opened by this miracle .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Let us leave that ! I pray you rise and tell me rather what has befallen Yaouma .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Yaouma !— Did she not at first interpret the thunderclap as sign of the wrath of Ammon against her ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: She believes still in Ammon , then , despite all I have said to her .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Happily I undeceived her . I made her understand that ‘ twas you the elements obeyed , that the thunder that frighted her , was but a sign of your power .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Why should you lie to her ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: It was not wholly lying . Besides , it was fortunate I could thus explain the event . Had you but seen her —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: All my efforts of these two months past , in vain !

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: You remember when you left us yesterday . You might have thought that all her superstitions were banished at last . She no longer answered you , she questioned you no more , and at your last words her silence confirmed the belief that at length you had won her away from Ammon . Yet after you were gone , at the moment of entering her hiding place , she was swept with sudden fury as though an evil spirit had entered her , wept , cried and tore her hair —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: What said she ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: “ To the temple ! to the temple ! I would go to the temple ! The God has chosen me ! The God awaits me ! Egypt will perish ! ” In short , words of madness . She would have killed herself !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Killed herself !

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: We had to put constraint on her . And ‘ twas only when I led her to this terrace , after the thunderbolt , and pointed out the scattered soldiery , that she came to herself , that at length she perceived that your God was the most powerful . “ What , ” she cried , “ ‘ tis he , he , my Satni , who shakes the heavens and the earth for me ! For me ! ” she murmured , “ for me ! ” She would have kissed your sandals , offered you a sacrifice , worshipped , adored you . See where she comes , with Mieris ! Stay .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No .

div.stage: He goes . Rheou accompanies him . Mieris enters , bearing flowers and led by Yaouma . MIERIS [ listening ] Is he there ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Leave me . Yaouma goes out . Mieris left alone makes several hesitating steps toward the statue of Isis , then goes up to it and touches it . A pause .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: If it be only of wood ! A gesture of disillusion . She draws slowly away from the statue , letting her flowers fall , broken-hearted , and begins to weep . Rheou returns .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Why , Mieris — do you bring flowers to Isis still ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: It is the last time . Listen , Rheou — We mast ask Satni to heal me . Do not tell me it is not possible ; he has healed Ahmarsti .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Healed Ahmarsti ? MIERIS , Yes . He made her drink a liquid wherein no doubt a good genius was hidden , and the evil spirit that tormented her was driven forth . RHEOUcredulouslyIs't possible ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Every one saw it . And Kitoui —

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Well ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Kitoui , the cripple , went this morning to draw water from the Nile , before all her neighbors who marvelled and cried with joy . And she had merely touched the hem of his garment , even without his knowing it . He has healed the child of Riti , too , he knows gods more powerful than ours — younger gods , perhaps , our gods are so old — If it were not so , how could he have walked unscathed the road where the scarabs lay , that day when he came home ? Since then , men have seen him do a thousand forbidden things , have seen him defy our gods by disrespect . Without the protection of a higher power , how could he escape the chastisement whereof another had died ? Who are his gods ? Rheou , he must make them known to you .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: He refuses .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: For what reason ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: The reason he gives is absurd — he says there are no gods —

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: No gods ! no gods !— he is mocking you .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: He is bound to secrecy , perhaps .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Rheou , know you that this Ahmarsti — these two years now , on the day of Prodigies , have I heard her at my side howling prayers at the goddess that were never answered .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: I know . Satni declares he could have healed all whom the goddess has relieved . MIERISto herselfHe relieves even those women whom she abandons —After a pauseHe must teach you the words that work these miracles .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: He refuses .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Force him !

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: He says there are none .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Threaten him with death — he will speak .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: No . MIERISwith excitementBut you do not understand me !— he has healed Ahmarsti , he has healed Kitoui , wherefore should he not heal me ? RHEOUsadlyAh ! Mieris , Mieris , think you I waited for your prayer , to ask him that ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Well — Well —?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: I could gain nothing but these words from him : “ Could I overcome the evil Mieris suffers from , even now should she rejoice in the splendor of day . ”

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Nothing is impossible to the gods , even to ours ; how much more then to his !— He did not yield to your prayers !— Insist , order , threaten ! Force him to speak . You have the right to command him . He is but the son of a potter after all . Let him be whipped till he yield . Do anything , have him whipped to the point of death — or better , offer him fields , the hill of date-trees that is ours ; offer him our flocks , and my jewels and precious stones — tell him we know him for a living god — but I would be healed . I would be healed ! I would see ! See !With angerAh ! you know not the worth of the light , you whose eyes are filled with it ! You cannot picture my misery , you who suffer it not ! You grieve for me , I doubt not , but you think you have done enough , having given me pity !— No , no , I am wrong — I am unjust . But forgive me ; this thought that I might be healed has made me mad . Rheou !— Think , Rheou , what it means to be blind , to have been so always , and to know that beside one are those who see — who see !— The humblest of our shepherds , the most wretched of the women at our looms , I envy them . And when , at times , I hear them complain , I curb myself lest I should strike them , wretches that know not their good fortune . I feel that all you , you who see , should never cease from songs of joy , and hymns of thanksgiving to the gods —With an outburstI speak of sight ! Think , Rheou , I have not even a clear idea of what it means “ to see . ” To recognize without touch , to know without need to listen . To perceive the sun another way than by the heat of its rays !— They say the flowers are so beautiful !— I would see you , my well-beloved . Oh ! the day when I shall see your eyes !— I would see , that you may show me some likeness of the little child we lost . You shall point out , among the rest , those that are most like to him . This misery — O my beloved !— I do not often speak of it — but I suffer it ! I suffer it !She is in his armsThey have taken from me the hope that our gods will heal me , if they give me nothing in its place , know you what I shall do ?— I shall go away , alone , one night , touching the walls , and the trees — and the trees , with my arms outstretched ; I shall go down as far as the Nile and there , gently , I shall glide away to death .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Peace , O my best beloved ! MIERISlisteningI hear him — he comes . I leave you with him ! Lead him to my door — love me — save me ! She attempts to go out , he leads her . Satni enters followed by Nourm , Sokiti , and Bitiou .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes ! Thou who art mighty !— Yes ! Yes ! Make me rich — I have had blows of the stick so long ! I would be rich to be able to give them in my turn !— You have but to speak the magic words . SATNIsomewhat brutallyLeave me ! I am no magician .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I , I do not ask for money . Listen not to him ; he is bad . I , I only ask that you make Khames die ; he has taken from me the girl I would have wed .Satni pushes him away . Sokiti , weeping , clings to his garmentsGrant it , I implore you — I implore you !— My life is gone with her — make him die , I pray you .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Leave me !

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Hear me . BITIOUcoming between them and striking SokitiBegone ! Begone ! He would not hear you !Sokiti goes outListen — listen — you see I made him go . All — all whom you will , I shall beat them for you . Listen — if you could make me tall like you , and steady on my legs — See — here — I have hidden away , safe , three gold rings , that I stole a while since ; I will give them you .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Go , take them to the high priest — BITIOUpitiablyI have given four to him already . Sokiti and Nourm are conferring together . Enter Rheou . They run away , Bitiou follows , falling and picking himself up .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: What do they want of you ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: They came here , following me . They believe me gifted with supernatural power , and crave miracles of me , as though I were a God , or a juggler . I am neither , and I work no miracles .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: None the less you have worked two miracles .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Not one .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: And you will work yet one more .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Never . I came hither not to perform miracles , but to prevent them .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: You will heal Mieris .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No one can heal her , nor I , nor any other .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Give her a little hope .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: How can I ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Tell her you will invoke your God , and that some day perhaps —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I have no God . If there be a god , he is so great , so far from as , so utterly beyond our comprehension , that for us it is as though he did not exist . To believe that one of our actions , to believe that a prayer could act upon the will of God , is to belittle him , to deny him . He is himself incapable of a miracle ; it would be to belie himself . Could he improve his work , he would not then have created it perfect from the first . He could not do it .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Our ancient gods at least permitted hope .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Keep them .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: In the heart of Mieris , you have destroyed them .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Do you regret it ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Not yet .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: What would you say ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Even if it be true that sight will never be given her , do not tell her so . Far better promise that she will be healed .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: And to all the others , must I promise healing too ? Because in a house I relieved a child , whose illness sprang from a cause I could remove ; because a woman , ill in imagination , did cure herself by touching my garment 's hem ; must I then descend to play the part of sorcerer ? I had behind me there , but now , a rabble of the wretched imploring me , believing me all powerful , begging for them and theirs unrealizable miracles . Should I then cheat them too , all those poor wretches , promising what I know I cannot give ? I came hither to make an end of lies , not to replace them with others . RHEOUwith passionAh ! You would not lie . You would not lie to the wretched . You would not lie to Mieris . You would lie to no one , is it so ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: To no one .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: We shall see !Calling rightYaouma !— Let them send Yaouma !To SatniNot to her either , then ? Good ; if you speak the truth to her , if you deny that you have supernatural power , if you force her to believe you had no hand in the miracle that saved her yesterday , she will give herself to the priests , or she will kill herself ! What will you do ? Yaouma enters , she tries to prostrate herself before Satni , who prevents her . In the meantime the Steward greatly moved has come to whisper to Rheou . RHEOUdeeply movedHe is there !

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: In person .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: ‘ Tis an order of the Pharaoh then ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes .

lg.l: He goes out with the Steward .
What is it ails you ? Why are you so sad ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: You will want nothing more of me , now that you are a god .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Be not afraid : I am not a god .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Almost . ‘ Tis a daughter of the Pharaoh you will marry now .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I will marry you .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: You will swear to .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: By Ammon ?—RecollectingBy your god ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: My god is not concerned with us .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Who then is concerned with us ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No one .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: You do not want to tell me . You treat me as a child — mocking me .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Why do you need an oath ? I love you , and you shall be my wife . YAOUMAradiantI shall be your wife !— I , little Yaouma , I shall be wife to a man whom the heavens obey !—A pauseWhen I think that you loosed the thunder for my sake —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No , vain child , I did not loose the thunder .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Yes , yes , yes — I understand . You want no one to know that you have found the book of Thoth — fear not , I know how to hold my peace .Coaxingly she puts her arms round Satni 's neck and rubs her cheek against hisTell me , how did you find it ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I have not found the book of magic spells ; besides , it would have profited me nothing .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Sit — you would not sit ? They say ‘ tis shut up in three caskets , hidden at the bottom of the sea .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I tell you again I neither sought , nor found it .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: What do you do then , to strike fire from heaven ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I did not strike fire from heaven . YAOUMAcrosslyOh ! I do not love you now !— Yes , yes , yes , I love you !A pauseSo it pleased you then , when you were going away in the galley , to see me run barefoot on the bank —?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yes . YAOUMAangryBut speak ! speak !Checking herself , then more coaxing stillYou wanted to weep ? No ? You said you did . For my part I know not , then , I could see nothing . But the day of your return , when you learned I was chosen for the sacrifice , then , then I saw your eyes — You love me — You said to me you would prevent me going to the Nile . I believed you not — you remember — Why ! even yesterday , yes , yesterday again , in spite of all your words , I was resolved to escape and go to the temple . It needed this proof of your power !— tell me , it was you who shook the heavens and the earth for me .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Again !— You must think but little of me , to believe I should reveal what you bade me keep secret .She lays her hands on Satni 's cheeksIt was you , was it not ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No , no , no ! a thousand times no !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: It was your gods then , your gods whom I know not .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Who was it then ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No one . YAOUMAout of countenanceNo one !A pauseYou possess no power that other men have not ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No . YAOUMAthe sameYou seem as one speaking truth .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I speak the truth .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: ‘ Tis a pity !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Why ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: It would have been more beautiful .A long grave pauseTo go in the barge , on the Nile , that too had been more beautiful . Rheou and the Steward enter RHEOUagitatedGo in , Yaouma .To the StewardConduct her to her mistress — and make known to her what has passed .Yaouma and the Steward go outSatni , terrible news has come to me : the Pharaoh , finding the people 's enmity increase against him , has taken fright , and striking first , the blow has fallen on me . My goods are confiscated . I am sent to exile . The palace Chamberlain , but now , brought me the order to quit my house to-day , and deliver myself to the army leaving for Ethiopia .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Can you do nothing against this order ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Yes . I can kill those who gave it .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Kill !

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Listen . I bring you the means to win the triumph of your ideas , and at the same time serve my cause . I can arm all the dwellers on my lands . We two must lead them . They will follow you , knowing you all powerful . Nay , hear me — wait . The soldiers , who fear you , will not dare resist us , we shall kill the high priest , the Pharaoh if need be — we shall be masters of Egypt .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I would not kill .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: So be it . Enough that you declare yourself ready to repeat the miracle of yesterday .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I would not lie .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: If you would neither kill nor lie , you will never succeed in governing men .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I would fight the priests of Ammon , not imitate them .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: You will never triumph without doing so . Profit by events . Do not deny the power they believe to be yours . Men will not follow you , if you speak only to their reason . You are above the crowd by your learning ; that gives you rights . You would lead them to the summits ; to get there , one must blindfold those who suffer from dizziness .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I refuse .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: One would think you were afraid of victory !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Rheou , ‘ tis not the victory of my ideas you seek , ‘ tis your own vengeance , your own ambition .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: They wish to rush the people of Egypt into an unjust and useless war . They hesitate ; they feel the people lacking zest , that is why they have delayed the going of the army till the feast of Prodigies . To-morrow they will make the goddess speak , and all those poor creatures will be led away . You can save thousands of lives by sacrificing a few .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I refuse . The truth will prevail without help from cruelty or falsehood .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Never . The crowd is not a woman to be won by loud wooing , but one who must be taken by force , whom you must dominate before you can persuade .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Say no more , Rheou , I refuse .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Blind ! Fool ! Coward ! Mieris enters , led by Yaouma . A moment later some men — Bitiou , Sokiti , Nourm .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Rheou !— where are you ? where are you ?Yaouma leads her toward himIt is true , this that I hear ?— Exile — Misery ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: It is true .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Courage — As for me , a palace or a cottage — I know not the one from the other .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: to SatniSatni , can you still refuse ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You torture me ! No , I will not be credited with power that is not mine ; to stir men up against their fellows — I would not kill , I tell you .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: I understand you , Satni — it is wrong to kill !— But look once more upon me — I am poor now , I am going away , will you not consent to heal me ? SATNIanguishedMieris — Could I have healed you , would it not be done already ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: You can do it ! I know you can do it ! Work a miracle .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: A miracle ! Show that your god is more powerful than our gods . A MANwho has just enteredHeal us !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I am not able .

sp.speaker: ANOTHER
sp.p: Work a miracle .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: There are no miracles !

sp.speaker: A MAN
sp.p: Then your gods are less mighty than ours .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yours do not exist . THE PEOPLEterrified at the blasphemyOh !

sp.speaker: A MAN
sp.p: Why do you lead us away from our gods , if you have no others to give us ?

sp.speaker: ANOTHER
sp.p: You shall not insult our gods !

sp.speaker: ANOTHER
sp.p: We will hand you over to the priests lest the gods smite us for hearing you !

sp.speaker: ANOTHER
sp.p: Ammon will chastise us !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: A MAN
sp.p: Isis will abandon us !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: It will not make you more wretched .

sp.speaker: ANOTHER
sp.p: Then show us you are stronger than our gods .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: A miracle !

lg.l: He is stronger than our gods ! }
YAOUMA . A miracle or I die ! }

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You demand it ! You demand a miracle . Well , then , you shall have one , I will do this , but in the presence of all ! Go ! go ! go throughout the domains — bring hither those you find bowed on the earth , or hung to poles for drawing water . Go you others , summon the slaves , the piteous workers — call hither the drawers of stones , bid them drop the ropes that flay their shoulders , bid them come .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: What would you do ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Convince them .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Now of a sudden , brutally ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Brutally .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Do you believe them ready ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You are afraid .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Day comes not suddenly on night , between them is the dawn . Delethi leads Mieris right under the peristyle .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I would have day , broad daylight — Now , at once , for all ! ‘ Tis a crime to promise them reward for their suffering . How do we know that they will ever be paid ?

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: They are so miserable —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: The truth — is the truth good only for the rich ? Will you add that injustice to all the others ? Behold them !Gradually the slaves and workers of all kinds have entered till they fill the stage . Amongst them Pakh , Sokiti , Bitiou the DwarfYes , behold them , the victims , behold the wretched ! I know you all . You , you are shepherd , you are worse nourished than your flocks , and your beasts , at least , are not given blows . They do not beat the cows nor the sheep . You , you sow and you reap ; beneath the sun , tortured by flies , you gather abundant crops . You sleep in a hole . Others eat the corn you made grow , and sleep on precious stuffs . You , you are forever drawing water from the Nile ; betwixt you and the ox they harness to another machine , there is no difference , and yet you are a man . You , you are one of those who drag great stones , to build the monuments of pride . You are a digger in the tombs , you live a month or more without sight of day . To glorify the death of others , you give your life . You are a trainer of lions for war ; your father was eaten — they would have wept had the lion died — How can it be that you accept all this , when you see beside you happiness without work , and abundance without effort ? I will tell you . ‘ Tis because , in the name of the god Ammon-Ra , they have said to you : “ Have patience , this injustice will last but a life-time . ” Fools ! nothing but that ! All the time you are on earth , suffer , produce for others . Content ye with hunger , you who produce food . Content ye with worse usage than the swine , you who have guard of them . Content ye to sleep in the open , you who build palaces and temples . Content ye with all miseries , you carvers of gold , and setters of precious stones . Look without envy , without anger , on the welfare of those who do nothing , all this will last only the whole of your lives ! After , in another world , you shall have the fulness of all the crops , and the joy of all the pleasures . Well , they lied to you : there is no island of souls , there are no happy fields , there is no life of atonement after this .Loud murmursThey have set up these gods for your servile adoration ; they have counselled you : “ Bow down , these gods will avenge you . ” They have said : “ Prostrate yourselves , these gods are just . ” They have said : “ Throw yourselves to earth , these gods are good . ” They have declared them all powerful ; shut them in sanctuaries of awful gloom , whence you are shown them once a year , to keep alive your terror of the Gods ; and last , they have made you believe no man may touch these images and live . I tell you they lied — I will show you they lied to you . Behold the most mighty Ammon — the father of the gods — I spit my hate at him ! Thou art but an idol ; I curse thee for evil men have done in thy name ! I curse thee in the name of all the enslaved , in the name of all those they have cheated with hopes of an avenging life ; in the name of all who for thousands of years have groaned and wept ; suffered insult , outrage , blows , death , without thought of revolt , because promises made in thy name had soothed their rage to sleep ! And I curse thee for the sorrow that now fills me , and for the ills that must come even of thy going ! Die !He throws a stool in the face of the statueYou others do as I . Go , climb their pedestals ! Lay hold of their hands , they are lifeless ! Strike , ‘ tis but an image ! Spit in their faces , they are senseless ! Strike ! Ruin ! All this is nothing but hardened mud ! The crowd which had punctuated the words of Satni with cries and murmurs has approached the statues behind him and followed his example , blaspheming , and howling with fury . The more courageous begin , being hoisted to the pedestals , the rest follow suit . The gods are overthrown .

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Now , let them open my granaries , that each may help himself ; and take from my flocks to sate you all . Cries of joy , they go out slowly . Bitiou in the meantime approaches an overthrown statue and still half-afraid , kicks it . He tries to run , falls , picks himself up , then seeing that decidedly there is no danger , seats himself on the stomach of the goddess Thoueris and bursts into a peal of triumphant bestial laughter .

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: Ah ! Ah ! Ah ! Ah ! Ah ! Ah ! Ah ! Ah ! Then he perceives the little statue of Isis which Mieris shields with her arms , points it out to a couple of men who advance to it .

sp.speaker: DELETHI
sp.p: Mistress , they would take Isis ! MIERISin tearsLet me keep her —

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: No , Mieris . MIERISletting goTake her —ThenStay !

sp.speaker: RHEOU
sp.p: Wherefore ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Can you part from her , and feel nothing ? Even now , Satni , in denouncing the gods to the fury of the crowd , you did not say everything — You , who can see her , behold this little image , think how many tears were shed before her , in the years since she was made . She has been ours for generations . Call up the countless crowds of those who have fixed their anxious looks upon her eyes , dead even as mine are . It is for all the anguish she has looked upon , we must respect her . Tears make holy . I doubt not you are right : she must be broken too — but not without farewell .To YaoumaWhere is she , Yaouma ? I would say my last prayer to her .To the statueOh , them who didst not heal , but didst console me ; O thou who hast heard so many entreaties and thanksgivings , thou art but clay ! Yet men have given thee life ; thy life was not in thee , it was in them — and the proof is that thou diest , now they have taken their soul from thee . I give thee over to those who would break thee , but I revere thee , I salute thee , and I thank thee for all the hope thou hast given me ; and I thank thee in the name of all the sorrows that thou hast sent to sleep .To the menTake her hence — let them destroy her with respect . They take Isis away .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: There is nothing so sad or so great as the death of a god !A pause . To Yaouma , who comes through the crowdBehold , Yaouma ! The gods are dead and I live — behold them ! Do you believe me — do you believe me ? Sadly Yaouma looks at the broken statues , then bursts into tears before Satni , who stands amazed .

div.stage: CURTAIN

div.head: ACT III

stage.stage: SCENE :— The yard in front of the potter 's hut . On the right from the middle of the back of the scene to the footlights , the walls of the dwelling made of beaten clay . Two unequal doors . The wall is slightly raised supporting a terrace where pottery of all kinds is drying in the sun . Left , a wall of loose stones high enough to lean on . Between the wall and the house an opening leading to an invisible inclined plane that descends to the Nile , the water and opposite bank of which are visible . Behind the house and on the right groups of lofty palms . The whole is abject misery beneath the splendor of a heaven blazing with light .
Kirjipa , crouching down , is grinding corn between a large and a small stone . Satni is seated on the wall dreaming .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: Son .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Mother .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: And so you do not believe that when the moon grows little by little less , ‘ tis because it is eaten by a pig ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No , mother .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: Then what beast eats it ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: None . KIRJIPAlaughingYou have ideas that are not reasonable . What makes me marvel , is that your father seems to understand them . I must haste to make the bread , that he find it when he returns .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Here comes the messenger from Rheou . KIRJIPAhorrifiedThe messenger of him who kills the gods .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: We do not kill what has no life .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: I would not see him .She picks up her corn

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Why ?

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: Brrr !—To herselfTo-morrow I shall burn some sacred herbs here .She goes outThe Steward enters .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Satni , I have been seeking you . Since this morning unhappy things have come to pass —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yaouma is not in danger , or Mieris , of Rheou ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: No . All three are safe in the palace .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Well ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: You remember the order the master gave me this morning , after the death of the gods ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yes , to open his granaries to all .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yes , yes , well ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: When I went to obey , to my amazement I beheld the men stand by the door in earnest converse , then without entering they withdrew . This is what happened . They went to the house of the neighboring master , roused his servants and laborers , and strove to force them to overthrow the statues of his gods , and rob him of his corn . They killed his steward . Soldiers came — Nepk had been killed , others too . Then all were scattered . The master sent me to bid you reason with those whom you might find . Look ! there are some who have taken refuge here !To some men who are outsideEnter — come — Satni would speak with you ! Bitiou , Sokiti , and Nourm appear behind the wall . Bitiou comes in . SATNITo BitiouWhither go you ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Whither go you ? Whence come you ?

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: I followed the others —

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Whence come you ?

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: I came back with the others , Sokiti and Nourm .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Where are they ?

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: There .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Bid them enter . SATNIgoing to the doorSokiti , Nourm , come . Sokiti and Nourm enter awkwardly .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Why do you hide yourselves ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: We do not hide from you , but from the Lybian soldiers .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Why do you fear them ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Because they are chasing us .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: And why are they chasing you ? The three men look at each other .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Bitiou , answer .

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: Bitiou knows not . STEWARDto the othersYou know it , you .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: They took us for the others .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: What others ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Perhaps they took us for the servants of the neighboring master .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: They have done mischief , then , the servants of the neighboring master ?PauseAnswer — you ! NOURMto SatniThey did that at his house , that you made us do at yours .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: The priests heard of it ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: No , but the master sent for the soldiers .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Only for that !

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: I know not .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Had there been nothing else , he would not have sent for the Lybian soldiers . He knew our projects — he is with us . There is something else , eh !— Bitiou yawns loudly .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: What ? SOKITIto NourmTell .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: They were angered with the master . He was bad , the master .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: He is hard , but he gives much to those who have nothing .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: He gave here , that he might receive hereafter .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: After his death .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: And now he gives no more ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Nothing .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Ah !

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: Nothing — and so , all stomachs empty , very much .He laughs

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: He gives only blows of the stick now . SOKITIwith convictionOne cannot live on that alone .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: And so his servants asked him for corn ?

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: No good — only blows of the stick .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: They took the corn that was refused them ? BITIOUlaughingHunger !A gesture

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You knew they were going to do that ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: It was for that you went to join them ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Why ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: It came into our heads like this : better not take corn from the good master , but take it from the bad one .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Justice ! BITIOUto the StewardYou content . You still got all your corn . He laughs , his comrades laugh with him .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: You , we like you .

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: You — good ! We — good !

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: See ! BITIOUcollecting two ideasWait : neighboring master bad . They bad .To the othersHeh ?— Heh ?— you see — Heh ? Heh ?All three draw themselves up proudly and laughAnd the steward he bad , he dead — well done !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: What would he say ? SOKITIlaughingThey took the steward and then —Chokes with laughter

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: They gave him back all the blows of the stick they had had from him .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You saw that ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes . SOKITIproudlyMe too , me too —

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: I laugh very much — because — because — Steward , very big , strong , and then when very much beaten , fell down — fell on the ground — like me ! like me ! He , big , he fell down just the same — he like Bitiou — I very glad .During what follows he plays with his foot

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: What they have done is bad .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: No . The steward had been happy all his life . He was old .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: He was old . So ‘ tis not bad to have killed him — He had finished — He was fat — and he had lost his appetite —

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Only just , he should leave his place to another .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: We must not kill .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: What does that mean ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes , kill a good one , that is bad . But kill a bad one , that is good .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: And if you are mistaken ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: No , he is bad , I kill him .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: What if he be not bad , and you think him so ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: If he were not bad , I should not think it .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: You do not understand — Listen , I am not bad , am I ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: But we do not want to kill you .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Let me speak . You remember Kob the black . He thought me bad .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: And if he had killed me ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: We are not blacks —

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: You do not understand me . Consider . He thought me bad . I am not bad . What you were saying , would justify him if he had killed me . They consider .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I understand . You say : If the slave had killed me — no , it is not that .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Human life must be respected . Gravely they make sign of acquiescence , to escape further torment . Nourm picks up a package he had brought and turns to go out unobserved .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: What are you carrying there ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Nothing , ‘ tis mine —

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: That is a necklace — show .Begins to open the package

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes , a necklace .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: From whom did you take it ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: From the neighboring master .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Do you think you did well ? NOURMhesitatingWhy — yes .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You are wrong .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Be not afraid , no one saw me .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: It is wrong .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: No . What can wrong me , is wrong . Since no one saw me , they will not punish me . So it is not wrong .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Wrong not to you , but to the neighboring master .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: He has many others .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Has had them for years , he has ! Nourm never had one . Not just . I , I never had , this —He holds up a bracelet

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You have taken this bracelet ! SOKITIdelightedIt is mine .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: We are content . They laugh .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: And Bitiou —

sp.speaker: SATNI AND SOKITI
sp.p: Yes , Bitiou —

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: He took the best thing .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: What ?

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: A woman .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: By force ?

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: No woman would come willingly with Bitiou .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: But she escaped from him .

sp.speaker: BITIOU
sp.p: Yes .He weeps

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You must give back the necklace and this bracelet to the neighboring master .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Give back , but he has others !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You cannot make yourself the judge of that . If you were selling perfumes , for instance , would you think it natural that a man should come and take them from you , because you had plenty and he had none ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: You tell me hard things .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You must give back this bracelet , Sokiti .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Yes , master .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: And you the necklace .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes , master . A sorrowful pause .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: See , you are sad . You perceive that you did wrong .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Yes , we did wrong —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Ah !

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: We did wrong to tell you what we did , because you are not pleased .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: ‘ Tis for your sake I am grieved .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Then you have not told the truth ; there is a hell , and there is an island of souls .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: If the gods do not punish , and men , not having seen , do not punish either —PauseWell — I shall give it back .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I , I shall not give back . Not stolen . Another , a servant of the neighboring master stole the bracelet , not I !

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Yet ‘ tis you who have it .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I took it from the other .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: He let you do it ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Yes . Could not help it , he was wounded .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You should have succored him .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I did not know him .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: He was a man like you .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: There are plenty of them .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: We must do good to others .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: What good will that do to me ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You will be content with yourself .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I would rather have the bracelet —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: It is only by refraining from doing one another harm that mankind may hope to gain happiness ; nay more , only by lending one another aid . Do you understand ? SOKITIgloomilyYes .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: If men did not steal bracelets —

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Well ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: Bracelets —He laughsSATNIto NourmAnd you ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: He was wrong to take the bracelet .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Why ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Because you are not pleased .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No , no , ‘ tis not for that .

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I was not wrong —

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: Yes ! wait ! I understand — If you steal , another may steal from you . Likewise if you kill —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Right . And why is it necessary to be good ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: WaitTo SokitiIf you do good to one whom you know not , another who knows you not , may do good to you .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Ah !— Do you understand , Sokiti ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: I think so .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Explain . SOKITIafter a great effortYou do not want us to steal bracelets from you —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I do not want you to steal from any one — Do you understand ?

sp.speaker: SOKITI
sp.p: No . STEWARDto Bitiou , who listens open-mouthedAnd you ?

lg.l: I — I have a pain in my head —
Satni comes to the Steward . Bitiou and Sokiti slip off .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: Look at them —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: The tree that was bent from its birth , not in one day can you make it straight ?

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: We must leave it what it is , or tear it down ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No , we must seek patiently to straighten it .With feelingAnd above all we must keep straight those that are young . Cries are heard outside .

sp.speaker: STEWARD
sp.p: What cries are those ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Women in distress . Yaouma enters , leading Mieris . Both are agitated .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Come , mistress — come — We are at the house of the potter , the father of Satni — Satni help — quick ! quick ! Run ! your father , Satni !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Mieris , Yaouma , how come you here ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: They will tell you — go !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Fly to the rescue , he is wounded !— I have sent to the palace for those who drive out the evil spirits .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: We were set upon by some men .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: He defended us — But they will kill him — go ! Satni and the Steward seize some arms left by Nourm and run out .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Yaouma ! He is wounded ! Wounded in saving us —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Alas ! MIERISlisteningWho is there ?

sp.speaker: NOURM
sp.p: I , mistress .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Nourm ! Run to the palace , bid them send hither those who drive forth the evil spirits —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Alas ! mistress , I do fear — already he has fallen — struck to earth .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: They will save him , they will bear him hither —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Will they bear him hither alive ? MIERISto NourmRun !— You hear !— Run to the palace , bid those who assist at the last hour be ready to come . If he have died defending us , the same honors shall be paid him as though ourselves were dead ! Go !Nourm goes out . A pauseNow , Yaouma , lead me out upon the road to the Nile .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Mistress , you seek to die ? Many then must be your sorrows !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Alas ! Alas ! Why did you discover my flight ? Why did you seek me , find me , and bring me back —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Had I not guessed your purpose ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: What have I left to live for ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: You have lived all these years in spite of your affliction , what is there that is changed ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: What is there that is changed ! You ask me what is changed ! Until now I lived in the hope of a miracle .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Perhaps it would never have come .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Even at my last hour I should have still looked for it .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Then you would have died believing in a lie — if what they say be true .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: What matter , I had smiled as I died , thinking death but the journey to a land where my lost child was waiting for me . The death of a child ! No mother ever can believe , at heart , in that . It is too unjust — too cruel to be possible . One says to oneself : it is but a separation ! Oh ! Satni , thy doctrines may be the truth . But they declare this separation eternal ; they make the death of our loved ones final , irreparable , horrible , therefore I foretell thee this : Women will never believe them ! What is there that is changed ?— Yesterday , children came playing close to us . You know how their cries and laughter made me glad — the voice of one of them was like the voice of mine . I made him come , I put out my hand , in the old way . I felt , at the old height , tossed hair , and the warmth of a living body . And I did not weep , but my voice spoke in my heart and said : “ Little child , thy years are as many as his , whom she-who-loves-the-silence took from me . But in Amenti , where he is , in the island of souls , he is happier than thou , for he is safe from all the ills that threaten thee . He is happier than thou . He lives beneath a sun of gold , amid flowers of strange beauty , and perfumed baths refresh him . And when she-who-loves-the-silence takes me in my turn , I shall see him , I shall see him for the first time — and I shall fondle him as I fondle thee , and none , then , may put us asunder . Go , little child , the happy ones are not on this side of the earth ! ” Now have I lost the hope of a better life before death , and the hope of a better life beyond as well . If you took both crutches from a cripple , he would fall . Only this twofold hope sustained me . They have taken it from me . And so , it is the end , it is the end — ‘ tis as though I were fallen from a height , I am broken , I have no strength left to bear with life : I tell you , it is the end , it is the end ! YAOUMAwith intense fervorMistress , they speak not the truth !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Our gods , did they exist , would already have taken vengeance .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Before the outrage , already , they had taken vengeance on you .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Good Yaouma , you would give me back my faith , you who could not keep your own .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Mistress , I lied to you ; nothing is destroyed in me .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: You refuse to give yourself in sacrifice !— Oh , you are right ....

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I do not refuse .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: You do not ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: No . Know you how I learned , a while ago , that you were gone ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: How ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I , too , was seeking to escape .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: You ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: To go to the temple , to place myself in hands of the priests , to give to Ammon the victim he has chosen .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Do you believe in all these fables still ? YAOUMAin a low voiceMistress , I have seen Isis .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Has one of her images been spared then ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: It was not an image that I saw . It was Isis herself , the goddess — I have seen her .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: You — you have seen — what is it ? I know not what you say — to see — that word has no clear sense for me .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: She has spoken to me —

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: You have heard her voice —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I have heard her voice .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: How ! How !— You were sleeping — ‘ twas in a dream —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I did not sleep . I did not dream . I saw her . I heard her . I was alone , and I wept . A great sound filled me with terror . A great light blinded me . Perfumes unknown ravished my senses . And I beheld the goddess , more beauteous than a queen . Then all was gone —

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: But her voice —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: The next day she came again , she spoke to me , she called me by name and said to me : “ Egypt will be saved by thee . ”

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Why did you not speak of it ?

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I feared they would not believe me .

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Oh , Yaouma , how I envy you ! If you but knew the ill they have done me . They have half killed me , killing all the legends and all the memories that were mine . They made me blush at my simplicity . I felt shamed to have been so easily fooled by such gross make-believes . And now , what have I gained by this revelation ? My soul is a house after the burning , black , ruined , empty . Nothing is left but ruins , ruins one might laugh at .In tearsI am parched with thirst , I hunger , I tremble with cold . They have made my soul blind , too . I cry out for help , for consolation . Oh ! for a lie , some other lie , to replace the one they have taken away from me !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Why ask a lie ? Why not forget what they have said . Why not recall what you learned at your mother 's knee — Why not , yourself , set up in your heart again , those images which they threw down —

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Yes ! Yes ! I will do it . They have awakened my reason , and killed my faith . I shall kill my reason , to revive our gods . Though I no longer believe , I shall do the actions of believers — and , if my god be false , I shall believe so firmly in him that I shall make him true !— Yes , the lowest , the most senseless superstitions , I venerate them , I exalt — I glory in them ! The ugliest , the most deformed , the most unreal of our gods , I adore them , and I bow down before their impossibility .She kneelsOh , I stifle in their petty narrow world , sad as a forest without birds ! Air ! Air ! Singing ! The sound of wings ! Things that fly ! YAOUMAkneelingLet me be sacrificed !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Let me have a reason for living !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I would give my life to the gods who gave me birth !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: I would believe that there is some one above men !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Some one who watches over us !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Who will console as with his justice !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Some one to cry our sorrows to !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Yes , some one to pray to , and to thank ! YAOUMAsobbingOh ! the pity of it , to feel we were abandoned ! MIERISthrowing herself in Yaouma 's armsI would not be abandoned !

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: We are not ! Gods ! Gods !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Gods ! We need gods ! There are too many sorrows , it is not possible this earth should groan as it groans beneath a pitiless heaven — Ammon , reveal thyself .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Isis , show thyself ! Have pity !A pause . Then in a hushed voiceMistress , I think she is going to appear to me again !— Isis !— mistress — do you hear — MIERISlisteningI hear nothing .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: Singing — the sound of harps — ‘ tis she —

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: I do not hear —

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: She speaks ! Yes — goddess !

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Do you see her ? YAOUMAin ecstasyI see her ! She is bending down above us —

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: O goddess !—

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: She is gone — Mistress , you could not see her , but did you hear the sound of her feet ?

sp.speaker: MIERIS
sp.p: Yes , I believe I heard it — I believe and I am comforted .

sp.speaker: YAOUMA
sp.p: I am happy ! To the temple ! She beckoned me ! To the temple ! Come ! They go up . Rheou meets them and leads them away . Satni enters with some men bearing Pakh , who is wounded . Kirjipa almost swooning follows , supported by some women who lead her into the house . The Exorcist , who with his two assistants follows Pakh , takes some clay from a coffer carried by one of his men , shapes it into a ball , and begins , then , the incantation .

sp.speaker: EXORCIST
sp.p: Pakh ! Son of Ritii ! Through thy wound an evil spirit has entered thee . I am about to speak the words that shall drive him out : “ The virtues of him who lies there , and who suffers , are the virtues of the father of the gods . The virtues of his brow are the virtues of the brow of Thoumen . The virtues of his eye are the virtues of the eye of Horus , who destroys all creatures . ” A pause .

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: Begone !

sp.speaker: EXORCIST
sp.p: His upper lip is Isis . His lower lip is Neptes , his neck is the goddess , his teeth are swords , his flesh is Osiris , his hands are divine souls , his fingers are blue serpents , snakes , sons of the goddess Sekhet —

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: Begone ! I no longer believe in your power ! EXORCISTtaking a doll from the cofferHorus is there ! Ra is there ! Let them cry to the chiefs of Heliopolis —

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: Have done ! He knocks down the doll which the Exorcist holds over him . The music stops suddenly .

sp.speaker: EXORCIST
sp.p: The evil spirits are strongest in him . He will die . Only his son has the right to be with him at death . All go out save Pakh and Satni .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: My father —

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: You are there , my son — ‘ tis well — I am glad — that that maker of spells is gone .SimplyHeal me .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yes , father , you shall be healed . But you must have patience . PAKHsimplyHeal me , now , at once .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I cannot .

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: Why do you not want to heal me ?— See you not that I am wounded — I suffer — come , give me ease —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I would give all , that it were in my power to do so .

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: You know prayers that our priests know not —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I know no prayers . PAKHin anguishYou are not going to let me die ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: You will not die — have confidence .

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: Confidence ? In what ?A pauseYou cannot heal me ?

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I cannot .

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: All your knowledge , then , is but knowledge of how to destroy — My son !— I pray you — my blood goes out with my life — I do not want to die ! I pray you — give me your hand . I seem to be sinking into night — hold me back — you will not let me die — your father ! I am your father . I gave you life — hold me back — all grows dim around me — But at least do something — speak — say the incantations —He raises himselfNo ! No ! I refuse to die ! I am not old .StronglyI will not ! I will not ! Do not let go my hand ! I would live , live — All my life , I have worked , I have sorrowed , I have suffered — Satni — will you let me go before I share the peace and happiness you promised —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Oh ! My father !

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: You weep — I am lost , then — Yes — I have seen it in your eyes . And the silence deepens around me . To die — to die —A long pauseAnd after ?PauseAnd so this is a poor man 's life ! Work from childhood , blows . Then work , always , without profit . Only for bread . And still work . For others . Not one pleasure . We die . And ‘ tis finished ! You came back to teach me that — Work — blows — misery — the end .A silenceWhat did you come here to do ? Is that your work ?StronglySatni , Satni ! Give me back my faith ! I want it ! Ah ! Why were you born a destroyer ? Is that your truth ? You are evil — you were able to prove that all was false . Prove to me now that you lied ! I demand it ! Give me back my faith , give me back the simple mind that will comfort me .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Do not despair —

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: I despair because the happy fields do not exist —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: Yes , father , yes , they exist —

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: You lied , then !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: I lied .

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: They exist — and if I die —

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: If you die , you will go to Osiris , you will become Osiris .

sp.speaker: PAKH
sp.p: It is not true . ‘ Tis now you lie — There is no Osiris ! There is no Osiris ! Nothing ! there is nothing — but life . I curse you , you who taught me thatHe almost falls from his litter , Satni reverently lifts him upAh ! accursed ! Accursed ! I die in hate , in rage , in fear . Bad son ! Bad man ! I curse you , come near .Seizing him by the throatOh ! If I were strong enough !— I would my nails might pierce your throat — Ah ! Ah ! accursedHe lets him goAll my life lost ! All my suffering useless !— Forever — Never ! Never ! shall I know — Pity !He holds out his arms to Satni and falls deadSATNIhorror-strickenHe is dead !—He lifts him reverently and lays him on the litterFather ! For me , too , at this moment there would have been comfort in a lie — He weeps , kneeling by the body with his arms stretched over it . Kirjipa appears at the door of the house . She comes near , then standing upright cries out to the four points of the horizon , tearing her hair .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: The master is dead ! The master is dead ! The master is dead ! The master is dead ! The five mourners appear outside , Delethi , Nazit , Hanou , Zaya , and Nagaou . KIRJIPAwith cries that are callsThe master is dead ! The master is dead ! MOURNERSenteringThe master is dead ! The master is dead ! Music till the end of the scene .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: O my father ! MOURNERSlouder and in a chantO my master ! O my father !

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: O my beloved !

sp.speaker: MOURNERS
sp.p: The she-wolf , death ; the she-wolf , death ; the she-wolf , death , has taken him ! They rush at the body , kissing it with piercing cries . They beat their breasts , uttering long cries , after silent pauses . Kirjipa and another woman dance a hieratic dance , their feet gliding slowly over the ground . They bend to gather handfuls of earth , which they scatter on their heads as they dance . The cries are redoubled . KIRJIPAafter bowing before the corpseGo in peace towards Abydos ! Go in peace towards Osiris !

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: Towards Abydos ! Towards Osiris ! To the West , thou who wast the best of men !

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: If it please the gods , when the day of eternity comes , we shall see thee , for behold thou goest towards the earth that mixeth men .

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: Towards Abydos ! Towards Osiris ! They make believe to bear away the corpse ; ritual movements .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: O my husband ! O my brother ! O my beloved ! Stay , live in thy place . Pass not away from the earthly spot where thou art ! Leave him ! Leave him ! Wherefore are ye come to take him who abandons me . MOURNERSin a fury of despairGroans ! Groans ! Tears ! Sobs ! Sobs ! Make , make lamentation without end , with all the strength that is given you . The music stops . KIRJIPAto the corpseDespair not . Thy son is there ! They point to Satni .

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: Despair not . Thy son is there !

sp.speaker: DELETHI
sp.p: When I have spoken , and after me Hanou , and after her Nazit , thy son will speak the magic words , whose power shall make thee go even unto Osiris , before the two and forty judges . They shall place thy heart in the balance , and thou shalt say : “ I have done wrong to no man , I have done nothing that is abominable in the sight of the gods . ” SATNIto himselfNo , I will not speak the magic words . The music begins again .

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: Despair not ! Thy son is there !

sp.speaker: HANOU
sp.p: Despair not , thy son is there . When I have spoken and after me Nazit , thy son will say the magic prayers whose power shall bring thee even unto Osiris , and thou shalt say : “ I have starved none , I have made none weep , I have not killed , I have not robbed the goods of the temples . ” SATNIto himselfNo , I will say no useless words .

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: Despair not ! Thy son is there !

sp.speaker: NAZIT
sp.p: Despair not ! Thy son is there ! When I have spoken he will say the sacred words whose power shall bring thee even unto Osiris and thou shalt say : “ I did not filch the fillets from the mummies , I did not use false weights , I did not snare the sacred birds . I am pure — ”

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: I am pure ! I am pure !— KIRJIPAcontinuingGive to me what is my due , to me who am pure . Give me all that heaven gives , all that the earth brings forth , all that the Nile bears down from its mysterious springs . Despair not ! Thy son is there ! Thy son will say the sacred words !

div.stage: A pause . All look at Satni .

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No , I will not say words that are lies !

div.stage: General consternation . Kirjipa comes to him and lays her hands on his shoulders .

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: Speak the sacred words !

sp.speaker: SATNI
sp.p: No !

sp.speaker: KIRJIPA
sp.p: Accursed ! She falls in a swoon . The women press round her . Satni bursts into sobs .

div.stage: CURTAIN

div.head: ACT IV

stage.stage: SCENE :— The interior of a temple .

Columns , huge as towers and covered with hieroglyphics . On the left the Sanctuary ; in the foreground in a little nook , invisible to the faithful , but visible to the audience is installed the machinery for the miracle , a lever , and ropes . Against the central pillar two thrones , one magnificent , that of the Pharaoh ; the other simple , that of the High Priest .
The Pharaoh , the High Priest , an officer , an old man , and six priests discovered . When the curtain rises all are seated , the priests on little chairs between the two thrones .
THE OFFICER [ prostrated before the Pharaoh ] Pharaoh ! may Ammon-Ra preserve thy life in health and strength !

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: with furyMy orders ! My orders !

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: Lord of the two Egypts , friend of Ra , favorite of Mentu , may Ammon —

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Enough ! my orders !

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: I would have died —

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: The wish shall be granted , be assured , and soon ! My orders ! Dog , why did you not carry out my orders ?

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: Satni —

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Satni ! Yes , Satni , the impostor ! Where is he ?

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: Pharaoh — may Ammon , Soukou Ra , Horus —

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: I will have you whipped till your blood run — Satni ! Where is Satni ! I sent you to seize him ! Where is he ?

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: No one knows .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Scoundrel ! You are his accomplice !

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: O Ammon !

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Did you go to the house of his father , to Rheou ?

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: We searched them in vain .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: He has taken flight , then ?

sp.speaker: THE OFFICER
sp.p: I know not .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: You are a traitor ! You shall die ! Take him out ! And you others , hear the commands of the High Priest and begone .

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: Let each fulfil the mission he is charged with . Let the young priests mix with the crowd , the moment it enters the Temple . Let them excite the people 's fervor , that as many prodigies as possible may be won from the goddess . Now when you are gone the stones that screen the sanctuary will roll away before the Pharaoh and the High Priest ; and , first by right , they shall behold the goddess face to face . Humbly prostrated we shall speak to her the mysterious words that other men have never heard . Bow down before the Pharaoh , may he live in health and strengthAll kneel and remain with their faces on the ground during what follows , save an old man whom the High Priest calls to his side by a sign ; and to whom he says in low tonesLet the man Satni be taken from the crypt where he is imprisonedThe old man bowsWhen I give the signal let them bring him here . While the Pharaoh goes in procession through the town let them do what I have told youThe old man bowsTo the othersRise !To the PharaohSon of Ammon-Ra , bow down before him who represents the god .The Pharaoh rises and after a slight hesitation bows down before the High PriestWithdraw , we would pray .Motionless the High Priest and the Pharaoh wait till the last of the assistants are goneTHE PHARAOHgiving up his hieratic pose , angrilyI would all the flies of Egypt might eat thy tongue . HIGH PRIESTwithout feelingThe flies of Egypt are too many and my tongue is too small , for your wish to be realized , Pharaoh .

lg.l: This is the result of my weakness !
Ammon-Ra — Lord of the two Egypts — Friend of Ra —

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Enough ! Enough ! We are alone . There are none whom your words may deceive . And your mock-reverence fools not me . You would not let me put Satni to death , your subtleties confused my mind , I gave in to you , and now Satni escapes us .

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: You should not let anger master you for that .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Satni has foretold to thousands of ears that there will be no miracle .

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: The miracle will be .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Who knows that ? HIGH PRIEST . I .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Satni has declared he will enter the temple —

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: ‘ Tis possible .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: He has declared he knows the secret recess , whence one of your priests makes the head of the image move .

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: Most like he speaks the truth .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: He declares the miracle will not take place . If the people suffer this disappointment , tell me what chance can there be for the war of conquest I would wage in Ethiopia ?

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: Why wage a war of conquest in Ethiopia ?

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: I need gold . I need women . I need slaves . There will be a share of the spoil for your temple .

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: I like not bloodshed .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: The treasury is empty . Our whippings are useless now . Our blows no longer bring forth taxes . If the people lose confidence in the gods , what will happen to-morrow ? Who will follow me , unless they believe the gods confirm my orders ?

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: Satni will not prevent the miracle .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: What do you know of it ?

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: I know .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Is Satni dead ?

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: He lives . THE PHARAOHsuddenly guessingYou are hiding him !

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: You knew I was about to rid me of him , and you took him to prevent me ?

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: What do you intend ?

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: It shall be done with him as I wish , not as you wish .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: His crime is a crime against Egypt .

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: A crime against me . That is still more grave . Therefore be satisfied .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
sp.p: Why then all these ceremonies before you kill him ?

sp.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
sp.p: That all may know his faults .

sp.speaker: THE PHARAOH
